abstract: The behind-the-scenes battle over federal approval of Google‘s proposed $3.1 billion acquisition of DoubleClick could shape the Internet’s future, The Los Angeles Times wrote. At stake is control of the growing online advertising market, estimated at $21.7 billion this year.
lead_paragraph: The behind-the-scenes battle over federal approval of Google‘s proposed $3.1 billion acquisition of DoubleClick could shape the Internet’s future, The Los Angeles Times wrote. At stake is control of the growing online advertising market, estimated at $21.7 billion this year.

headline.main: Decision on Google Deal May Shape Web

abstract: Google‘s recent purchase of Postini could be a prelude to more deals in the security business, according to the research firm 451 Group. It speculates that the Web search giant might try deals in the areas of URL filtering, anti-data leakage and identity and access management.
lead_paragraph: Google‘s recent purchase of Postini could be a prelude to more deals in the security business, according to the research firm 451 Group. It speculates that the Web search giant might try deals in the areas of URL filtering, anti-data leakage and identity and access management.

headline.main: After Postini, What’s Next for Google?
